To translate a Chinese written number to Arabic numerals, simply replace each digit in the Chinese number with its corresponding numerical value:

* One is represented by "一" (yī) which becomes 1 when translated.
* Ten is represented by "十" (shí) which becomes 10 when translated.
* Hundred is represented by "百" (bǎi) which becomes 100 when translated.

Therefore, "一 hundred 二" translates to 120 in Arabic numerals.

For example, "一" represents the value 1 while "十" represents the value 10, and so on.
